arts.ttl: 'I learnt from Kevin De Bruyne and Wayne Rooney but now I'm at Ryan Reynolds' Wrexham'
arts.sum: Wrexham midfielder George Evans gained experience next to some big name stars at Manchester City and has also credited Manchester United legend Wayne Rooney for aiding his career

arts.ttl: Reading boss on 'really pleasing' Wrexham win and 'ridiculous' Stickland red card
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt labelled referee Edward Duckworth's decision to send off Michael Stickland 'ridiculous', but the Royals still beat Wrexham 2-0. On top throughout, it took second half goals from Harvey Knibbs and Lewis Wing to seal the victory against Phil Parkinson's in-form side. However, the win was not without controversy as 21-year-old Stickland received a second yellow card for time-wasting. "It was ridiculous- I can’t catch my breath with it," Hunt said post-match. "It happens every week in every game.

arts.ttl: 10-man Reading beat promotion-chasing Wrexham to extend unbeaten run to nine
arts.sum: 10-man Reading deservedly beat promotion-chasing Wrexham 2-0 at the Select Car Leasing Stadium upon Sam Smith and Phil Parkinson's return to Berkshire. 'Parky' and his Wrexham side, aiming for three successive promotions, had won their previous five away league matches and bought Smith from Reading in January. However, second half goals from Harvey Knibbs and Lewis Wing ensured the Royals had the outcome they deserved, a big win and a ninth match unbeaten for the first time since 2012. Michael Stickland had been sent off in controversial fashion late on, picking up a second yellow card for delaying a restart.

arts.ttl: Promotion-chasing Wrexham slip up as Reading reignite play-off bid
arts.sum: Harvey Knibbs, from a penalty, and Lewis Wing struck.

arts.ttl: Live updates: Sam Smith and Phil Parkinson return as Reading host Wrexham
arts.sum: Reading host big-spending Wrexham at the SCL Stadium as Phil Parkinson and Sam Smith return to Berkshire. The North Wales outfit can go clear in the automatic promotion race with a win, but the Royals need three points to keep up with the play-offs.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Chem Campbell returns from the start for Wrexham meeting
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt has made two changes for the visit of Wrexham AFC, with Chem Campbell returning from the start. The Wolves loanee missed the last two home matches and was a second half substitute for Saturday's 1-1 draw with Crawley Town. However, for the visit of promotion-chasing Wrexham, Hunt has opted to replace both wingers. Campbell and Jayden Wareham come in, with Kelvin Ehibhatiomhan likely to go out wide with Wareham through the middle.

arts.ttl: Former Reading coach replaces long-time colleague at struggling Tranmere Rovers
arts.sum: Former Reading coach Andy Crosby has replaced his long-time colleague Nigel Adkins at Tranmere Rovers. Crosby was Adkins' assistant at Scunthorpe United, Southampton, Reading, Sheffield United and Hull City before taking on managerial roles of his own at Port Vale. Adkins, who was at Reading between 2013 and 2014, was sacked by his hometown club with Tranmere sat 22nd out of 24 in League Two, four points clear of the relegation zone. Named interim, Crosby will continue until at least the end of the current campaign.

arts.ttl: Former Reading youngster returns to league football after 10 months out
arts.sum: Former Reading defender Michael Hector has returned to football after 10 months out with Dagenham and Redbridge. The 32-year-old graduated from the Royals Academy and went on to make nearly 80 appearances, earning a big move to Chelsea in 2015. Failing to make an impact at Stamford Bridge, the Jamaica international had four loan spells away from West London, including a spell with Eintracht Frankfurt in the Bundesliga.
